Detailed Description

Contains functions for handling module instances.

Author:
Trevor Williams (trevorw@charter.net)
Date:
3/11/2002

Function Documentation

void instance_db_write (  mod_inst *    root,
FILE *    file,
char *    scope,
bool    parse_mode
) 
 

Displays contents of module instance tree to specified file.

Parameters:
root  Root of module instance tree to write.
file  Output file to display contents to.
scope  Scope of this module.
parse_mode  Specifies if we are parsing or scoring.
Calls each module display function in instance tree, starting with the root module and ending when all of the leaf modules are output. Note: the function that calls this function originally should set the value of scope to NULL.

void instance_dealloc (  mod_inst *    root,
char *    scope
) 
 

Removes specified instance from tree.

Parameters:
root  Root of module instance tree.
scope  Scope of module to remove from tree.
Searches tree for specified module. If the module instance is found, the module instance is removed from the tree along with all of its child module instances.

mod_inst* instance_find_by_module (  mod_inst *    root,
module *    mod,
int *    ignore
) 
 

Returns instance that points to specified module for each instance.

Parameters:
root  Pointer to root module instance of tree.
mod  Pointer to module to find in tree.
ignore  Pointer to number of matches to ignore.
Returns:
Returns pointer to module instance found by scope.
Searches the specified module instance tree for the specified module. When a module instance is found that points to the specified module and the ignore value is 0, a pointer to that module instance is passed back to the calling function; otherwise, the ignore count is decremented and the searching continues.

mod_inst* instance_find_scope (  mod_inst *    root,
char *    scope
) 
 

Finds specified scope in module instance tree.

Parameters:
root  Root of mod_inst tree to parse for scope.
scope  Scope to search for.
Returns:
Returns pointer to module instance found by scope.
Searches the specified module instance tree for the specified scope. When the module instance is found, a pointer to that module instance is passed back to the calling function.

void instance_gen_scope (  char *    scope,
mod_inst *    leaf
) 
 

Builds full hierarchy from leaf node to root.

Parameters:
scope  String pointer to store generated scope (assumed to be allocated)
leaf  Pointer to leaf instance in scope.
Recursively travels up to the root of the instance tree, building the scope string as it goes. When the root instance is reached, the string is returned. Assumes that scope is initialized to the NULL character.

void instance_parse_add (  mod_inst **    root,
module *    parent,
module *    child,
char *    inst_name
) 
 

Adds new instance to specified instance tree during parse.

Parameters:
root  Root mod_inst pointer of module instance tree.
parent  Pointer to parent module of specified child.
child  Pointer to child module to add.
inst_name  Name of new module instance.
Adds the child module to the child module pointer list located in the module specified by the scope of parent in the module instance tree pointed to by root. This function is used by the db_add_instance function during the parsing stage.

void instance_read_add (  mod_inst **    root,
char *    parent,
module *    child,
char *    inst_name
) 
 

Adds new instance to specified instance tree during CDD read.

Parameters:
root  Pointer to root instance of module instance tree.
parent  String scope of parent instance.
child  Pointer to child module to add to specified parent's child list.
inst_name  Instance name of this child module instance.
Adds the child module to the child module pointer list located in the module specified by the scope of parent in the module instance tree pointed to by root. This function is used by the db_read function during the CDD reading stage.
